plot_utils module¶

plot_utils.add_2d_text_at_point_3d_ax(ax, point, text, *args, **kwargs)¶
plot_utils.add_line_to_2d_ax(ax, points, *args, **kwargs)¶
plot_utils.add_line_to_3d_ax(ax, points, *args, **kwargs)¶
plot_utils.add_points_to_2d_ax(ax, points, *args, **kwargs)¶
plot_utils.add_points_to_3d_ax(ax, points, *args, **kwargs)¶
plot_utils.add_polygon_to_2d_ax(ax, points, *args, **kwargs)¶

Adds a 2D polygon to axes. If higher dimension polygon is given, will only keep the 2 first dimensions.

Parameters

  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes) – axes

  • points (numpy.ndarray shape(N, M>=2)) – the points of the polygon

  • args (any) – positional arguments passed to matplotlib.patches.PathPatch()

  • kwargs (any) – keyword arguments passed to matplotlib.patches.PathPatch()

plot_utils.add_polygon_to_3d_ax(ax, points, *args, **kwargs)¶

Adds a 3D polygon to axes. If higher dimension polygon is given, will only keep the 3 first dimensions.

Parameters

  • ax (mpl_toolkits.mplot3d.Axes3D) – axes

  • points (numpy.ndarray shape(N, M>=3)) – the points of the polygon

  • args (any) – positional arguments passed to mpl_toolkits.mplot3d.art3d.Poly3DCollection()

  • kwargs (any) – keyword arguments passed to mpl_toolkits.mplot3d.art3d.Poly3DCollection()

plot_utils.add_text_at_point_2d_ax(ax, point, text, *args, **kwargs)¶
plot_utils.add_text_at_point_3d_ax(ax, point, text, *args, **kwargs)¶
plot_utils.add_vector_to_2d_ax(ax, point, vector, *args, **kwargs)¶

Adds a 2D vector to axes. If higher dimension vector is given, will only keep the 2 first dimensions.

Parameters

  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes) – axes

  • point (numpy.ndarray shape(N, M>=2)) – the origin of the vector

  • vector (numpy.ndarray shape(N, M>=2)) – the direction of the vector

  • args (any) – positional arguments passed to matplotlib.pyplot.quiver()

  • kwargs (any) – keyword arguments passed to matplotlib.pyplot.quiver()

plot_utils.add_vector_to_3d_ax(ax, point, vector, *args, **kwargs)¶

Adds a 3D vector to axes. If higher dimension vector is given, will only keep the 3 first dimensions.

Parameters

  • ax (mpl_toolkits.mplot3d.Axes3D) – axes

  • point (numpy.ndarray shape(N, M>=3)) – the origin of the vector

  • vector (numpy.ndarray shape(N, M>=3)) – the direction of the vector

  • args (any) – positional arguments passed to mpl_toolkits.mplot3d.Axes3D.quiver()

  • kwargs (any) – keyword arguments passed to mpl_toolkits.mplot3d.Axes3D.quiver()

plot_utils.get_2d_plot_ax(ax=None)¶

Returns axes on which 2D geometries can be plotted.

Parameters

ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes) – If a matplotlib axes given, will return it

Returns

axes

Return type

matplotlib.axes.Axes

plot_utils.get_3d_plot_ax(ax=None)¶

Returns axes on which 3D geometries can be plotted.

Parameters

ax (mpl_toolkits.mplot3d.Axes3D) – If a matplotlib axes given, will return it

Returns

axes

Return type

mpl_toolkits.mplot3d.Axes3D

plot_utils.set_spherical_axes_label(ax)¶
